item.title: Nothin' But ASP.NET: Use Cache, Save Cash
item.description: Learn how to use database cache invalidation in ASP.NET 1.1 with a similar technique as the one used by ASP.NET 2.0.

item.title: Working with the ASP.NET 2.0 ObjectDataSource Control
item.description: Learn how to use the ObjectDataSource control to build a proper multi-tier Web application with the ASP.NET 2.0 Framework.

item.title: Using HTTP Modules and Handlers to Create Pluggable ASP.NET Components
item.description: Scott Mitchell and Atif Aziz show how to use HTTP modules and handlers to add error logging to your ASP.NET applications.

item.title: Introducing the ASP.NET 2.0 Web Parts Framework
item.description: Web Parts provide you with the infrastructure for creating customizable Web applications. When you build a Web site with Web Parts, the Web site can be easily customized by either the administrator of the Web site or the individual users of the Web site. Web Parts are all about flexibility.

item.title: ASP.NET 2.0 Localization Features: A Fresh Approach to Localizing Web Applications
item.description: Creating global Web applications with Microsoft ASP.NET is becoming more and more important. ASP.NET 2.0 makes it even easier to provide support for multiple cultures and locales through improved runtime and tool support.

item.title: Dynamic Creation of Validation Controls
item.description: Use an XML configuration file to control the dynamic creation of ASP.NET validation controls that are automatically applied to user input controls.

item.title: A DetailsView Control for ASP.NET 1.x
item.description: Experience ASP.NET 2.0-like ease of development when building master/details views with ASP.NET 1.x with Dino Esposito's custom control.

item.title: The .NET Show: Connected Systems
item.description: In this episode, we talk with Don Box and Doug Purdy about how today's networking infrastructure can be utilized in order to create a Connected System environment, and why this is important. Later, Eric Schmidt and Richard Turner walk us through several coding demonstrations which illustrate how this can be implemented and utilized.

item.title: Take Action on ASP.NET Vulnerability
item.description: Protect against a vulnerability in all versions of ASP.NET, which could allow a Web site visitor to view secured content by using specially crafted requests to a Web server.

item.title: Take Action on ASP.NET Vulnerability
item.description: Protect against a vulnerability in all versions of ASP.NET, which could allow a Web site visitor to view secured content by using specially crafted requests to a Web server.
